title: How to Make Mushroom Duxelles

steps.headline: Peel and finely chop your mushrooms, onion and garlic.
Heat a frying pan and melt the butter.
steps.description: Cook gently until the foam subsides and the butter start to turn a light nut brown colour and nutty aroma.

steps.headline: Add the mushrooms, onion and garlic and stir to coat in the butter.
steps.description: The heat must be adequate so that they will fry gently, but not stew or burn.

steps.headline: Add the parsley, salt and pepper to taste and stir well.
To use the duxelle, it may be added:
steps.description: Direct as a stuffing, or in with other stuffing ingredients, In a cream style soup, or spread on a crusty baguette Mixed with cream or bechamel white sauce and stirred into pasta, placed into vol-au-vents or pastry as small mushroom pies. Slice the mushrooms (instead of finely chopping them) and fry them in exactly the same method as above and serve as a side dish. Stirred into risotto or with mashed potato.

text: Peel and finely chop your mushrooms, onion and garlic.  Heat a frying pan and melt the butter. Cook gently until the foam subsides and the butter start to turn a light nut brown colour and nutty aroma. Add the mushrooms, onion and garlic and stir to coat in the butter. The heat must be adequate so that they will fry gently, but not stew or burn. Add the parsley, salt and pepper to taste and stir well.  Check for flavouring.  To use the duxelle, it may be added: Direct as a stuffing, or in with other stuffing ingredients, In a cream style soup, or spread on a crusty baguette Mixed with cream or bechamel white sauce and stirred into pasta, placed into vol-au-vents or pastry as small mushroom pies. Slice the mushrooms (instead of finely chopping them) and fry them in exactly the same method as above and serve as a side dish. Stirred into risotto or with mashed potato.
